meanings.definition: The quality of being intellectual or scholarly.
meanings.sent1: Her eggheadedness was evident in her love for reading and discussing complex ideas.
meanings.sent2: His eggheadedness shone through in his detailed analysis of the scientific research.
meanings.sent3: Despite his eggheadedness, he still enjoyed watching silly cartoons on weekends.
meanings.sent4: Her eggheadedness was a beacon of knowledge in a sea of ignorance.
meanings.sent5: The eggheadedness of the professor made the lecture both informative and engaging.

meanings.definition: The state of being overly focused on academic pursuits.
meanings.sent1: His eggheadedness led him to spend countless hours in the library studying.
meanings.sent2: The student's eggheadedness sometimes made it hard for them to relax and have fun.
meanings.sent3: Despite his eggheadedness, he still found time to play soccer with his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her eggheadedness was like a magnet pulling her towards the world of books and research.
meanings.sent5: The eggheadedness of the group was evident as they discussed their latest academic achievements.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for someone perceived as overly intellectual or bookish.
meanings.sent1: He was often teased for his eggheadedness by classmates who preferred sports over studying.
meanings.sent2: The comedian used eggheadedness as a punchline in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: Despite his eggheadedness, he could still appreciate a good joke.
meanings.sent4: Her eggheadedness was like a shield against the opinions of those who valued intellect less.
meanings.sent5: The eggheadedness of the character in the movie added a humorous touch to the plot.
